questions.question: Find the cost of laying grass in a triangular field of sides $50 \text{ m}$, $65 \text{ m}$ and $65 \text{ m}$ at the rate of Rs $7$ per $\text{m}^2$.
questions.solution:
Given: Sides of the triangular field are $a=50 \text{ m}$, $b=65 \text{ m}$, $c=65 \text{ m}$. Rate = Rs $7$ per $\text{m}^2$.

To find: Total cost of laying grass.

Explanation:
Semi-perimeter $s = \frac{50+65+65}{2} = \frac{180}{2} = 90 \text{ m}$.
Area $= \sqrt{s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}$
$= \sqrt{90(90-50)(90-65)(90-65)}$
$= \sqrt{90 \times 40 \times 25 \times 25}$
$= 25 \sqrt{3600} = 25 \times 60 = 1500 \text{ m}^2$.
Cost $= 1500 \times 7 = \text{Rs } 10500$.

questions.question: The triangular side walls of a flyover have been used for advertisements. The sides of the walls are $13 \text{ m}$, $14 \text{ m}$ and $15 \text{ m}$. The advertisements yield an earning of Rs $2000$ per $\text{m}^2$ a year. A company hired one of its walls for 6 months. How much rent did it pay?
questions.solution:
Given: Sides are $13 \text{ m}$, $14 \text{ m}$, $15 \text{ m}$. Rate = Rs $2000$ per $\text{m}^2$ per year. Time = 6 months.

To find: Rent paid.

Explanation:
$s = \frac{13+14+15}{2} = \frac{42}{2} = 21 \text{ m}$.
Area $= \sqrt{21(21-13)(21-14)(21-15)}$
$= \sqrt{21 \times 8 \times 7 \times 6}$
$= \sqrt{3 \times 7 \times 8 \times 7 \times 2 \times 3}$
$= \sqrt{7^2 \times 3^2 \times 16} = 7 \times 3 \times 4 = 84 \text{ m}^2$.
Rent for 1 year $= 84 \times 2000$.
Rent for 6 months $= 84 \times 2000 \times \frac{6}{12} = 84 \times 1000 = \text{Rs } 84000$.

questions.question: From a point in the interior of an equilateral triangle, perpendiculars are drawn on the three sides. The lengths of the perpendiculars are $14 \text{ cm}$, $10 \text{ cm}$ and $6 \text{ cm}$. Find the area of the triangle.
questions.solution:
Given: Perpendiculars from interior point are $p_1=14, p_2=10, p_3=6$.

To find: Area of the equilateral triangle.

Explanation:
Let the side of the equilateral triangle be $a$.
Area of triangle = Sum of areas of three smaller triangles formed by joining the point to vertices.
$\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}a^2 = \frac{1}{2} \times a \times 14 + \frac{1}{2} \times a \times 10 + \frac{1}{2} \times a \times 6$
$\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}a^2 = \frac{1}{2}a(14+10+6) = \frac{1}{2}a(30) = 15a$
$\Rightarrow \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}a = 15 \Rightarrow a = \frac{60}{\sqrt{3}} = 20\sqrt{3} \text{ cm}$.
Area $= \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} (20\sqrt{3})^2 = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} \times 1200 = 300\sqrt{3} \text{ cm}^2$.

questions.question: The perimeter of an isosceles triangle is $32 \text{ cm}$. The ratio of the equal side to its base is $3 : 2$. Find the area of the triangle.
questions.solution:
Given: Perimeter $= 32 \text{ cm}$. Ratio of equal side to base $= 3:2$.

To find: Area of the triangle.

Explanation:
Let the equal sides be $3x$ and base be $2x$.
Perimeter $= 3x + 3x + 2x = 8x = 32 \Rightarrow x = 4$.
Sides are $12 \text{ cm}, 12 \text{ cm}, 8 \text{ cm}$.
$s = \frac{32}{2} = 16 \text{ cm}$.
Area $= \sqrt{16(16-12)(16-12)(16-8)}$
$= \sqrt{16 \times 4 \times 4 \times 8} = 4 \times 4 \sqrt{8} = 16 \times 2\sqrt{2} = 32\sqrt{2} \text{ cm}^2$.

questions.question: Find the area of a parallelogram $ABCD$ if the sides of $\Delta BCD$ are $12 \text{ cm}$, $17 \text{ cm}$ and $25 \text{ cm}$. Also find the length of the altitude from vertex $A$ on the side $DC$ (where $DC = 12 \text{ cm}$).
questions.solution:
Given: Sides of $\Delta BCD$ are $12, 17, 25$. $DC = 12$.

To find: Area of parallelogram and altitude on $DC$.

Explanation:
For $\Delta BCD$, $s = \frac{12+17+25}{2} = \frac{54}{2} = 27 \text{ cm}$.
Area($\Delta BCD$) $= \sqrt{27(27-12)(27-17)(27-25)}$
$= \sqrt{27 \times 15 \times 10 \times 2}$
$= \sqrt{8100} = 90 \text{ cm}^2$.
Area of parallelogram $= 2 \times \text{Area}(\Delta BCD) = 2 \times 90 = 180 \text{ cm}^2$.
Area $= \text{Base} \times \text{Altitude}$
$180 = 12 \times h \Rightarrow h = 15 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: A field in the form of a parallelogram has sides $60 \text{ m}$ and $40 \text{ m}$ and one of its diagonals is $80 \text{ m}$ long. Find the area of the parallelogram.
questions.solution:
Given: Parallelogram sides $60 \text{ m}, 40 \text{ m}$, diagonal $80 \text{ m}$.

To find: Area of the parallelogram.

Explanation:
The diagonal divides the parallelogram into two congruent triangles with sides $60, 40, 80$.
$s = \frac{60+40+80}{2} = \frac{180}{2} = 90 \text{ m}$.
Area of one triangle $= \sqrt{90(90-60)(90-40)(90-80)}$
$= \sqrt{90 \times 30 \times 50 \times 10}$
$= \sqrt{1350000} = 100\sqrt{135} = 100 \times 3\sqrt{15} = 300\sqrt{15} \text{ m}^2$.
Area of parallelogram $= 2 \times 300\sqrt{15} = 600\sqrt{15} \text{ m}^2$.

questions.question: The perimeter of a triangular field is $420 \text{ m}$ and its sides are in the ratio $6 : 7 : 8$. Find the area of the triangular field.
questions.solution:
Given: Perimeter $= 420 \text{ m}$. Ratio of sides $= 6:7:8$.

To find: Area of the field.

Explanation:
Let sides be $6x, 7x, 8x$.
$6x + 7x + 8x = 420 \Rightarrow 21x = 420 \Rightarrow x = 20$.
Sides are $120 \text{ m}, 140 \text{ m}, 160 \text{ m}$.
$s = \frac{420}{2} = 210 \text{ m}$.
Area $= \sqrt{210(210-120)(210-140)(210-160)}$
$= \sqrt{210 \times 90 \times 70 \times 50}$
$= \sqrt{(21 \times 10) \times (9 \times 10) \times (7 \times 10) \times (5 \times 10)}$
$= 100 \sqrt{21 \times 9 \times 7 \times 5}$
$= 100 \sqrt{3 \times 7 \times 9 \times 7 \times 5}$
$= 100 \times 7 \times 3 \sqrt{15} = 2100\sqrt{15} \text{ m}^2$.

questions.question: The sides of a quadrilateral $ABCD$ are $AB = 6 \text{ cm}$, $BC = 8 \text{ cm}$, $CD = 12 \text{ cm}$ and $DA = 14 \text{ cm}$. The angle between the first two sides is a right angle. Find its area.
questions.solution:
Given: $AB=6, BC=8, CD=12, DA=14, \angle B = 90^\circ$.

To find: Area of quadrilateral $ABCD$.

Explanation:
Join $AC$. In $\Delta ABC$, $\angle B = 90^\circ$.
Area($\Delta ABC$) $= \frac{1}{2} \times 6 \times 8 = 24 \text{ cm}^2$.
$AC = \sqrt{6^2+8^2} = \sqrt{36+64} = 10 \text{ cm}$.
In $\Delta ADC$, sides are $10, 12, 14$.
$s = \frac{10+12+14}{2} = \frac{36}{2} = 18 \text{ cm}$.
Area($\Delta ADC$) $= \sqrt{18(18-10)(18-12)(18-14)}$
$= \sqrt{18 \times 8 \times 6 \times 4}$
$= \sqrt{3456} = \sqrt{576 \times 6} = 24\sqrt{6} \text{ cm}^2$.
Total Area $= 24 + 24\sqrt{6} \text{ cm}^2$.
